ygData.subject: RE: Mistmoore quest components
ygData.msgSnippet: well i died last night trying to train everything to the zone when trying to get the gypsie to the zone, too many casters are bad for bards health. i got to
ygData.messageBody:
well i died last night trying to train everything to the zone when trying to
get the gypsie to the zone, too many casters are bad for bards health.

i got to the musician no problem invisible, but be warned that gargs can see
through invis...

Minkin
Sol ro
lev 35 bard

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4 [SMTP:g4mntofcr@...]
> Sent: Friday, October 22, 1999 4:23 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Mistmoore quest components
>
> From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
>
> When all the details about the bard armor quests came out, I was initially
> disappointed that I would not be able to do the quests due to my level (25
> bard). I just assumed that I would have to wait until I was around 30th
> level before starting. I guess I have been lucky so far because I have
> been
> able to acquire six of the items. For a few of them, guildmembers in
> their
> mid 30s helped me out. For the others, people couldn't use/loot them them
> so they let me loot the items.
>
> Always willing to take a risk, I'm thinking about heading to Mistmoore
> after
> I get the bracelet in Unrest. Need to get an idea of how tough the deadly
> usher and gypsy musicians are. I hope to join with a higher level group
> (assuming they will accept a 25 bard in the group). Assuming a full group
> of six, what level characters are required to fight against these mobs?
>
> Also, the only places I've gone to in Mistmoore are the initial areas
> beside
> the lake and the graveyard. Nothing I ran into in those locations could
> see
> through the invisibility song. Are there any mobs deeper in the zone
> that
> can See Invis? I would assume that the DE casters can buff themselves
> with
> the spell. Got a bad feeling that all the gargoyles can as well. Still
> willing to take the chance though.
>
> Galtin of E'ci
>
> > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to toren@...
> with the subject lol.
